page.title: 12Lawn Wood Farm, Boynton
page.content: Lawn Wood Farm is on the main street in Boynton. The farm house is 300 years old and it is made of chalk. It has nine rooms and a slate roof. They have five tractors,two Internationals and three Fords. The implements they have are a seed drill,cultivator, harrows and harvesting equipment. There are some balers, a muck spreader, a corn sprayer, some trailers and manure fillers. There is a milking parlour, corn drying equipment and a blower. There are two full time men and one half time lady working on the farm as well as the farmer. They have 75.9 hectares of land; 49.3 hectares of grass including silage and 8.4 hectares of spring barley. They have 18.2 hectares of winter barley. They have 70 Friesian cows, 80 bullocks and some heifers on the farm.
